body_html: To be clear: the reason for requesting a different implementation is maintenance. We cannot commit to maintaining and testing a separate C++ kernel for every paper that comes out -- that's why modular ops written in python are preferable, except if it's really not practical (e.g., much slower, but I doubt it will be the case here). Putting things in contrib first is necessary because we commit to core APIs so things need to get some use first, before they get moved to contrib.

body: To be clear: the reason for requesting a different implementation is maintenance. We cannot commit to maintaining and testing a separate C++ kernel for every paper that comes out -- that's why modular ops written in python are preferable, except if it's really not practical (e.g., much slower, but I doubt it will be the case here). Putting things in contrib first is necessary because we commit to core APIs so things need to get some use first, before they get moved to contrib.
